intro: Ibervillea hypoleuca, commonly known as the white ibervillea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Cactaceae, which includes cacti and related succulent plants. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. The species is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited for xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
